subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Failure and Errors
msgSnippet: Thanks Joe. ... Surprisingly, this isn t in the FAQ (was it removed?) A failure is reported when an assertion doesn t have an expected value. An error is
messageBody:
Thanks Joe.

Joe Schmetzer <joe@...> wrote: On Wed, 7 June, 2006 2:03 am, saibabu_valluripalli wrote:
> I am executing JUnit test case using MyEclipse editor. I am seeing
> Failure and Error two out puts.
> What is the difference between a Failure and Error in JUnit?

Surprisingly, this isn't in the FAQ (was it removed?)

A failure is reported when an assertion doesn't have an expected value. An
error is reported where an exception is thrown out of a test method (such
as IndexOutOfBoundsException).

I guess the changes for JUnit 4 makes this distinction less relevant.

Cheers,
--
